notes: modal verb; irregular present; used with auxiliary 'avere'
example_sentence_english: Where there is a will there is a way.
If we want we can leave now.
Do you want to go out?
We want to see the movie.
Do you (plural) want to come with us?
I was wanting to call you.

translation_english: he was wanting/she was wanting/you (formal) were wanting
example_sentence_english: She was wanting to leave early.
They were wanting to play outside.
You have wanted to change jobs.

translation_english: he has wanted/she has wanted/you (formal) have wanted
notes: used with auxiliary avere; also used as formal 'Lei'

example_sentence_english: You (plural) have wanted to take a risk.
They have wanted to speak right away.
